name: Hambi Fox
description:
The trees at Hambacher Forst are about 350 years old. The whole area is wooded since ca. 12.000 years. It’s undeniable: The forest is an important habitat for numerous animals since ages.

The Hambacher Forst offers a home to various rare and protected animals. They raise their families in the forest, there they find their food and homes. The further clearing of the Hambacher Forst means the animals will lose their homes or will be killed during clearing.

This fade doesn't only apply to animals at Hambacher Forst, but everywhere around the world. Inform yourself about the topic – even small things can change a lot.
